CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 21, 1961, reads: "Negro Leaders Seek Jobs, Inspector - A cross-section of Negro civic, religious and business leaders, headed by Arthur C. (Chester) Holloway of the Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League, met with Mayor Joseph Barr, far left, in his office on Friday in a demand for "a police inspector NOW!" and top level and rank-and-file jobs for Negroes throughout the city and county setups.  Left to right: Mayor Barr, the Rev. J.B. Cayce, pastor of Ebenezer Baptist Church, representing the Baptist Ministers Conference; Mr. Holloway, GPIL president-elect; Leonard Browne, retired city policeman and president of the Business and Professional Association; the Rev. J.G. Harris, pastor of Bethel AME Church, representing the AMEs; Vivian Mason, secretary of the Tavern Owners Association; the Rev. Leroy Patrick, pastor of Bethesda Presbyterian Church, Moderator of Pittsburgh Presbytery, and Manford Sales, GPIL president. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mayor Joseph Barr, meeting with Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League (GPIL) committee, from left: Rev. J. B. Cayce, Arthur C. Holloway, Leonard Browne, Rev. J. G. Harris, Vivian Mason, Rev. LeRoy Patrick, and Manford Sales, in mayor's office
